title: Barcelona and Real Madrid 'set to battle it out for Spain and Napoli star Fabian Ruiz'
text:
Barcelona and Real Madrid are reportedly to go head-to-head in a transfer tug-of-war for Spain and Napoli midfielder Fabian Ruiz.

The Clasico rivals are in the market for a new central midfielder amd it appears that the 23-year-old has been earmarked by both, according to Goal.

Ruiz has developed into one of the most coveted central midfield players in Europe since moving to Naples from Real Betis for £26m in 2018.

Barcelona and Real Madrid are reportedly to go head-to-head in the chase for Fabian Ruiz

It is reported that Barca are planning wholesale changes to their midfield over the next few transfer windows, with Ivan Rakitic the most high-profile player set for the exit.

Real are also looking to renew their ageing midfield with Luka Modric into the final 12 months of his deal and Toni Kroos approaching his 30s.

But any move for the Spain international could cost upwards of £87m if the Serie A club can agree a new deal with Ruiz with an improved release clause.

Ruiz only made his international debut earlier this year but has already emerged as a starter under Roberto Moreno, and was in the XI for the 1-1 draw with Sweden on Tuesday night.
description: Barcelona and Real Madrid are reportedly to go head-to-head in a transfer tug of war for Spain and Napoli star Fabian Ruiz. Both clubs are in the market for a new central midfielder.
